Summary Viraj is a Senior Engineering Manager/Principal Engineer/Tech Lead for the iSearch (Intent Search) team at Yahoo! Search. During his time at Yahoo!, Viraj has worked on/built/launched several industry leading products including Yahoo! Knowledge Graph(Search Entity Graph), Quick Answers on Search Results Page, search clients (toolbars), email and Social networks (Yahoo! Mail/Imap) , high performance web destinations (Yahoo.com). 
 
Innovation areas include algorithms for inserting dynamic content in email protocols, search monetization, web browser manipulation and biometric security (cancelable biometrics). Filed 6 patents in the above areas. 
 
•	12+ experience in C/C++/Java. 
•	12+ years of experience in building scalable client-server architectures.  
• Experience developing with Hbase, Hadoop, Pig Latin, apache, experience with Ajax, JavaScript, html/css, perl on FreeBSD and Windows platforms. 
•	5+ years of experience in developing Firefox and IE clients with a user base of 200 million. 
•	Solid understanding of the business and customer fundamentals for a client/server web product 
•	Internationalization experience for web based products. 
•	Experience in working in a team and communicating with and leading large discussion groups. 
•	Self Starter with proven analytical, research skills. 
 
Have applied engineering and business acumen in not only identifying opportunities for monetizing products but also providing significantly improved user experiences. 
 
Passionate about innovating, developed ideas and algorithms that have made an impact on hundreds of millions of web users.  
 
Like working with smart people and have strong work ethics.

Google Scholar Link: http://scholar.google.com/citations?user=h-fDyqMAAAAJ&hl=en Experience Senior Engineering Manager/Principal Engineer/ Tech Lead (Intent Knowledge - Yahoo! Search) Yahoo March 2014  – Present (1 year 6 months) Sunnyvale Tech Lead on a new initiative in Yahoo! Search that ties the user search query to a specific intent. Leading a team of engineers to build a new intelligent system that learns of and deduces user intent. Yahoo! Search Knowledge Graph - Tech Lead (Yahoo! Search) Yahoo Search March 2013  –  March 2014  (1 year 1 month) Sunnyvale Tech lead and the first engineer on Yahoo! Search Team that developed and launched the first-of-its-kind Yahoo! Knowledge Graph on production. Was responsible for the architecture, design and implementation of the first end to end Yahoo! Knowledge Graph that powered around 3 million entities on production .  
 
Also, Invented and built the algorithm that powers the "Actors in the movie"​ and "Related Movies and TV shows"​ strip that you see when search on a celebrity entity on Yahoo! Search Page.  
 
Check it out!  
 
https://search.yahoo.com/search;_ylt=AiNxU31qIeTEGx0Tqzl6ujabvZx4?p=Brad+Pitt&toggle=1&cop=mss&ei=UTF-8&fr=yfp-t-431 
 
https://search.yahoo.com/search;_ylt=AiNxU31qIeTEGx0Tqzl6ujabvZx4?p=Troy&toggle=1&cop=mss&ei=UTF-8&fr=yfp-t-431 
 
As new team members onboarded the effort, i played the role of a mentor and that of an engineering lead expanding and scaling the first version of knowledge graph.  
 
Responsible for design and implementation of  
1) Hbase based data storage ,  
2) internal schemaless search engine to discover data,  
3) scalable grid processing pipelines based on pig/hadoop. 
 
Designed and implemented the Soccer Knowledge Graph that powers the Yahoo! Search FIFA experience in 25 markets (39 languages including double byte languages such as arabic)  
 
Search on 'Cristiano Ronaldo" on Yahoo! Search box on Yahoo.com or search box and you will see the experience that yahoo! offers. This knowledge graph powers the 200x increase in search query volume during FIFA world cup event internationally. 
 
My work is now the seed and crux of a wider effort within the company that revolves around knowledge building from various internal and external sources. Yahoo! Mail (IMAP-Mobile) - Tech Lead Yahoo! September 2009  –  March 2013  (3 years 7 months) Mobile eMail Monetization (IMAP), March 2011 (Yahoo! Inc) 
Engineering Lead for design and development for IMAP content snippets on mobile clients. 
Designed and implemented systems and algorithms for mobile email monetization on IMAP that scale for more than 200 million daily emails. Filed 4 patents.  
Got the Individual You Rock Award. 
 
Nginx based Mail Proxy Servers IMAP/POP Yahoo! Mail, May 2010-Mar 2011 (Yahoo! Inc) 
Rewrote IMAP Gate with NGINX that helped us enable SSL for all clients while reducing hardware cost by over 1 million dollars per year. IMAP is the first end point of the Y! Mail to support SSL, extending IMAP Server capabilities and its performance. As a result it is now open to all Mobile devices, and the servers are handling 2 Billion sessions a day. Got the Team You Rock Award. 
 
AutoProfiling Ymail IMAP Code Base, April 2010 (Yahoo! Inc) 
Designed, developed and integrated ymail_yautoprof, which allows autoprofiling of c++ code using yprof. Can be used by other properties in Yahoo! Extremely efficient, saves developer time, protects against future refactoring of code. 
Created a web interface that allows user to analyze the data. 
 
IMAP for desktop clients, Jan 2010 (Yahoo! Inc)  
 
Implemented LSUB, Subscribe and Unsubscribe for Desktop clients. 
Designed and developed Subscriptions for Desktop clients with an intelligent implementation for maintaining subscription lists in face of client (outlook, thunderbird) behaviors. Senior Software Engineer Yahoo! August 2004  –  March 2013  (8 years 8 months) During 10+ years at Yahoo!, I have worked on several key first-of-its-kind projects that have reached out to 300 million+ internet users and worked with and managed smart people all over the world from Silicon Valley to Bangalore. Check out the different teams/projects i worked on at Yahoo! Yahoo! Integrated Consumer Experiences - Senior Engineer Yahoo! April 2009  –  October 2009  (7 months) Was the lead architect and developer for a number of key components. 
 
Vespa-Content Crawler/Document Processing Chain, April 2009(Yahoo! Inc) 
 
Designed and implemented a perl based mechanism to input a seed list of web urls into the vespa-crawler. Extensive knowledge of crawler internals. Also implemented document processors that add/use attributes.  
 
Feed Source Manager Web Service, Aug 2009(Yahoo! Inc) 
 
Designed and implemented feed source manager web service that fetches data from Coke and Buzz, aggregates them and exposes them to a vespa crawler in a custom xml format. This was implemented using perl processing scripts and php/yapache.  
 
Backend Content Api Web Service, Sept 2009 (Yahoo! Inc) 
Designed and implemented an internal web service that processes content obtained from multiple sources (COKE scoring server) and Vespa index to construct and deliver an atom based feed.. Used phpunit for unit testing. YSM Lead - Internationalization (Search Partner Distribution) Yahoo! August 2008  –  January 2009  (6 months) Launched 18 international versions of Yahoo! client and web server (edit pages,backend server side logic). Used babel, set up distribution flows for partner deals like Adobe, Symantec and CNET. Yahoo! Audience - Architect and Team Lead for Client Backend Infrastructure Yahoo! August 2006  –  2008  (2 years) Designed and implemented staged-migration of more than 100 million toolbars from an existing platform called IDAHO to the new HELIX platform without affecting a live revenue stream of 240 million dollars. Was nominated for Yahoo Superstars for this project. Was responsible for writing server side migration components in c++ and php. 
 
Successfully tuned the performance for the nascent production machines that serviced 200 million active live yahoo! clients. Worked involved optimizing yapache child processes, cou monitoring, apc based caching, setting up ytee environments, profiling of code and optimizing udb reads/writes and managing connections with external properties like mail, messenger and weather platform Yahoo! Audience and Ads, Senior Engineer - Architect for Web Server Back-End Infrastructure Yahoo! September 2005  –  October 2006  (1 year 2 months) Designed and developed a scalable php/yapache-based web platform that serves more than 250 million toolbar clients world wide. Worked on various core components including writing php Arcade accessors for Mail Alert integration, Mesenger Integration.The platform takes 15k hits/second on US colos. Got the You Rock Award for this project. Yahoo! Search - Senior Software Engineer (Search - Firefox Clients) Yahoo! February 2005  –  September 2005  (8 months) Developed the first Firefox Yahoo! Toolbar. Implemented and integrated an innovative Antispy Plugin for the client by my own initiative. Launched on multiple platforms and intls. Read about it here: http://www.ysearchblog.com/2005/04/05/no-platform-left-behind/ Yahoo! Search - Software Development Engineer Yahoo! August 2004  –  September 2005  (1 year 2 months) Developed and worked on IE Toolbar Client and Search Clients, driving 15% of Yahoo! Search Revenue Research Associate Center for Unified Biometrics and Sensors(CUBS) August 2001  –  August 2004  (3 years 1 month) Buffalo/Niagara, New York Area Encryption of Biometric Data 
 
Designed and implemented a technique to encode biometric data by transformations in complex space and hashing based approaches to achieve acceptable verification rates and ensuring the privacy of the user information. The study aims at outline ways to obtain a hash of fingerprint image and still achieve acceptable rates of verification. Currently the rates are 4% Equal Error rate for FVC2002 database for fingerprint verification. Implemented using C++. 
 
Security and Matching of Partial Fingerprint Matching Systems, Security and Defense Symposium, SPIE Conference 04. 
Symmetric Hash functions for Fingerprint Minutiae, Biometrics Symposium, Salt Lake City, VA Research Associate - USPS-Lockheed Martin Center for Excellence in Document Analysis and Recognition(CEDAR) May 2001  –  August 2004  (3 years 4 months) Buffalo/Niagara, New York Area Intelligent Mail Project-USPS 
 
Design of optimum 4 state barcode, development of software for Australian, Canadian, UK standards, encoding and decoding information and studying the effect of noise models, for United States Postal Services’ Intelligent Mail Project. The project involved software simulations of encoding and decoding of data, error introduction and correction. Results were compared with similar experiments for other standards including the one proposed by Lockheed Martin. Implemented using C++. Software Engineer Independent Consultant February 1998  –  July 2001  (3 years 6 months) Mumbai Area, India Freelancing and working on challenging software projects. Developed a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) based system to query Management Information Base (MIB) based data models. Summary I have a strong passion for computer science and software engineering. I pride myself in my ability to quickly pick up new technologies and run with them. I have a broad base of knowledge and experience, which might make me a generalist in some sense. I can talk theoretical computer science, and at the same time write and develop software with a pragmatic understanding of the engineering required. When the work day ends, I tend to write code in my spare time, usually in an effort to expand my knowledge and understanding of different languages and frameworks. I pride myself and strive every day to write "clean code", taking an artisan view and approach to things. Writing software isn't just a job for me, it's a passion I love. 
 
Some of my experiences include: 
Object Oriented software development, Java J2EE, RESTful web services (JAX-RS) and GWT client/server. I've designed and developed systems that run the gamut of web-tech, both front and back end. Experienced with GNU Linux and shell scripting, I have a solid command of the Linux environment and use it every day - both as a desktop development environment and as a sever/enterprise system. I'm an emacs junkie and feel that it's one of the better tools I've learned (Pragmatic Programmer #22: http://blog.codinghorror.com/a-pragmatic-quick-reference/). 
 
Experience with the following Libraries, Frameworks, Languages & Tools: 
Google Web Toolkit (GWT), JavaScript, Java, git, svn, maven, ant, Eclipse, GNU Emacs, HTML/CSS, Angularjs, Nodejs, Netbeans, JBoss AS, PostgreSQL, Hibernate ORM, JMS, GWT-Ext.  
 
I attend the University of Southern California part time through their DEN program (remote), and when time allows I contribute to open source. 
 
Current hobbies: Clojure.

Principal Software Development Engineer/Architect (~Sr. Engineering Mgr) Yahoo! June 2008  –  April 2012  (3 years 11 months) San Francisco Bay Area •	Part of Yahoo!’s next generation online advertising platform serving team. 
•	Architected, designed and developed Yahoo!’s ad serving gateway – a large, distributed and highly scalable (global peak load of 150K queries per second) system serving all of Yahoo!’s ad serving traffic under stringent latency requirements. Implemented using C++ and memory based dbm on Linux. 
•	Designed and developed Yahoo!’s public facing ad serving API for partners: http://help.yahoo.com//l/us/yahoo/apt/sguides/pub_guides/ (needs valid account for access). Implemented using C++ on Linux. 
•	Designed and developed a highly secure network and global opt-out API for Yahoo!’s next generation advertising system. Implemented using C++ on Linux. 
•	Designed and developed several features such as techno targeting, mobile targeting, and contract black listing for the core multi-threaded ad server. Implemented using C++ on Linux. 
•	Designed and developed a highly secure cookie mapping service and API that permits third party networks to map modified X-cookies, generated by the online advertising system, to user IDs used within the third party network (e.g., 3PN User ID). I was awarded a patent (# 20100228597) for this. Implemented using C++ on Linux. 
•	Technically led and managed a team of 4 to 5 junior and senior engineers and delivered several high profile features for Yahoo!’s next generation advertising system with high quality for more 3 years in a row. 
•	Led the cross-org efforts of migrating all of Yahoo! traffic from the old ad serving system to the new ad serving system through several bake tests. Led Yahoo-wide supply migration to content-based taxonomy. This culminated in the smooth migration of all Yahoo sites in production. 
•	Found and fixed several critical security vulnerabilities while serving as the security liaison for our team with the central security team in Yahoo. 
•	Received the MVP award in 2011 in the Y! Display Ad Organization among 800 employees. Software Development Engineer (Technical Yahoo!) Yahoo! September 2005  –  June 2008  (2 years 10 months) •	Part of Yahoo!’s Merchant Solutions team that develops an e-commerce service supporting >40K online stores with billions of dollars in sales. 
•	Designed and developed REST based web service API’s for Order management. This was the first REST API developed that allowed backend integration of Yahoo! Store’s order sub-systems with our partners. Implemented using C++ on FreeBSD. API URL: http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/smallbusiness/store/api/api-01.html and http://help.yahoo.com//l/us/yahoo/smallbusiness/store/api/docs/. 
•	Designed and developed the integration of Google sitemaps with Yahoo! Stores to allow merchants to market their sites effectively and draw traffic. Implemented using C++ and Perl on FreeBSD. 
•	Designed and implemented a feature that gives the ability to plug-in new templates and designs to the current Y! Store editor. Implemented using C++ and Perl on FreeBSD. Software Security Developer and Auditor Bloomberg L.P. September 2002  –  September 2005  (3 years 1 month) •	Part of Bloomberg’s Central Security Team. 
•	Designed and developed a validation API in C to facilitate secure code development throughout the company. 
•	Exposed multiple revenue impacting security holes while conducting application security assessments (C, C++, Java, FORTRAN, ksh and Perl) using source code analysis and/or black box tests. 
•	Exposed critical vulnerabilities at the core infrastructure level and recommended secure designs to reduce the risk of internal and external attacks. 
•	Designed and developed custom exploit code for various Unix (DGUX) utilities as well as for in-house application software to demonstrate the severity of vulnerabilities identified and to improve management and programmer security awareness. 
•	Delivered highly detailed documentation outlining security problems, exploits, recommended secure alternatives and followed through with the programmers to get the vulnerabilities fixed. 
•	Developed a checklist based security procedure to expedite security reviews by more than 50%. 
•	Successfully trained developers in secure coding practices, latest vulnerabilities and their impacts to the company thereby reducing the occurrence of the same security mistakes by more than 30%. Experienced in designing and implementing large-scale systems on data sets of millions of users. 
 
• Strong analysis, architecture and design skills using Java, PHP, C++ and Design Patterns.  
• Hands on experience in designing and developing highly scalable web applications and multi-tiered systems 
• Design and implement core back-end software components 
• A quick learner. Code in a variety of languages(Java, PHP, C++, JavaScript etc.) but worked primarily on Java/PHP.  
• Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of various system resources.  
• Have a sound understanding of building highly scalable and distributed systems at Yahoo scale.  
• Have a sound understanding of full stack development ( Front end and Backend). Worked on different full stack technologies at Yahoo.

Summary Hello, thanks for taking a look at my LinkedIn profile. 
 
Here's how I'd describe my professional experience and goals. 
 
I enjoy creating and maintaining web-based tools to make the jobs of engineers, and non-engineers alike, easier. I've created content management systems, click-through-rate (CTR) stats reports, automated feed processing scripts using PHP, MySQL, Perl and Apache. I have been coming up to speed on professional frontend development using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to make desktop-like applications. I'd like to do more. 
 
In contrast to prototypical engineers who primarily hone their "hard" technical skills, I like to use and develop my "soft" skills as well. I communicate effectively with feature-crazed product managers, stressed-out project managers, detail-oriented QA teams, and relevancy-seeking editors. I seek to understand what they want so that I can give them what they need with the goal of delighting them in the process. Oh, and I love to write thorough twiki pages, it's the only way to write living docs.  
 
And finally, I'd like to say that I love to work at Internet companies. I enjoy the sprints of work, the variety of co-workers national and international, and the direct impact on people's lives online and offline. 
 
Thanks,

Thanks,
